intro: Cotylelobiopsis, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their rosettes of velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. Cotylelobiopsis species are typically evergreen and thrive in humid, well-drained environments. They are popular houseplants due to their ornamental value and ease of care. The genus includes several species, such as Cotylelobiopsis densiflora and Cotylelobiopsis hirtella, which are prized for their compact growth and vibrant blooms.
